email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I have a vessel available for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. The vessel is a 150,000 DWT Aframax with an LOA of 250 meters. The laycan is October 15-20. I’m quoting a freight rate in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate seems a bit high. Given the current market, we were hoping for something closer to $49.50 per metric ton. Can you check with the owner if they can adjust? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I discussed your counteroffer with the owner. They’re willing to come down to $50.00 per metric ton, but that’s their final offer. The vessel is in excellent condition and can meet your laycan window. Let me know if this works for you. Cheers, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for following up. $50.00 per metric ton is acceptable, provided the demurrage rate is reasonable. Can you confirm the demurrage terms? Also, please confirm the vessel’s ETA at Houston. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear that $50.00 works for you. The demurrage rate is $20,000 per day, pro rata. The vessel is currently en route and expected to arrive at Houston on October 14. Let me know if you need anything else. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the details. The demurrage rate is acceptable. Let’s proceed with the fixture at $50.00 per metric ton. Please send over the recap for review. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Fixture Recap - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, as discussed, here’s the recap: Vessel: MV Ocean Star (150,000 DWT, LOA 250m), Cargo: Crude Oil, Load Port: Houston, Discharge Port: Rotterdam, Laycan: October 15-20, Freight Rate: $50.00 per metric ton, Demurrage: $20,000 per day. Please confirm if everything looks good. Best regards, Sarah
